results.title: Roads in the sky
results.creator_credit: International Civil Aviation Organization. Public Information Office
results.brief_description: Role of aviation in less technologically developed regions of the world. Tells the story of how the aeroplane helps economic development where roads and railways cannot economically be built. Includes a modern Canadian airport; a Mardi Gras, and mountainous terrain with old and new modes of land travel in Haiti; air commerce in the Brazilian hinterland and Brazilia.

results.title: Rivers of ice
results.brief_description: Provides aerial views and photographs exploration on foot of the Franz Josef and Fox glaciers of New Zealand. Includes views of some of the glacial lakes.

results.title: Rip-offs
results.creator_credit: Alex Stiff and Victoria. Ministry of Consumer Affairs
results.brief_description: Animation in the style of “Life Be in it”, outlining money making scams the consumer should be aware of. Uses real life stries to illustrate these pitfalls with cartoon characters ‘Oscar Wilde’ and ‘Samuel Johnson’.

results.title: Riding on air: the HM-2 Sidewall hovercraft
results.creator_credit: Ken Blackman and Southern Photographic Studios

results.title: Riding for the disabled
results.creator_credit: Antonius Kroger and Kuratorium fur Therapeutisches
results.brief_description: A demonstration of how horses and horse riding are used as therapy for mentally handicapped children. Shows how the therapeutic techniques help develop both physical and social skills.

results.title: Rice and Agricultural Development
results.creator_credit: National Farm Cinema Association of Japan
results.brief_description: Japan, as the most advanced agricultural nation of Asia, has the experience and technique to help Afro-Asian economies, by improvements in agriculture. As part of this assistance, the Ibaraki International Agricultural Training Centre teaches better rice cultivation to foreign students.z

results.title: Retirement villages: a consumer guide
results.creator_credit: Garry McKechnie, Andrea Philipp and Village Communique
results.brief_description: Buying into a retirement village is a big step and one that leads to further, more complicated issues. This series of 3 videos and booklet attempts to work through these issues and help make the final decision about buying into a retirement village, an informed one. The 3 tapes cover lifestyle, financial and legal issues. The book provides a step by step guide to the process as a whole.

results.title: Responsible pet ownership
results.creator_credit: Department of Natural Resources and Environment
results.brief_description: This video contains some practical tips and useful information on the following areas of dog and cat ownership: choosing a pet; taking care of your pet’s health; general wellbeing; cat and dog registration; teaching children how to behave around dogs; knowing the signs of a frightened or threatening dog and more. Begins with five 30 second advertisements which were screened on national television in the year 2000 concerning responsible pet ownership and continues with two short videos on pet owners and their responsibilities to the animals.

results.title: Report to the gods
results.creator_credit: Brian Salt, David Marchbank and Hong Kong Film Unit
results.brief_description: A review of Hong Kong showing many aspects of life in the great city as seen through the eyes of a ‘household god’ who comes to life. He reports to the gods on what his family has achieved in the previous year, in the fields of education, housing and medicine, and in the making of all the fine things of the old world and all those of the new world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Salt, David Marchbank and Hong Kong Film Unit

results.title: Report from Queensland. No. 2. The Herds move in
results.brief_description: Looks at the beef export industry in Queensland. Shows how cattle are taken annually from Queensland to New South Wales for fattening and takes note of how more hardy strains of cattle are bing bred.
